qas.question: What is the most common dialect spoken in the Sahara?
What language is mainly spoken in West Africa?
What was the traditional language of Bureaucratic affairs?

plausible_answers.text: Berber inhabitants of the Canary Islands

qas.question: Who originally spoke the Beja language?
The French language is under what family?

plausible_answers.text: inter-personal discourse and commerce within the region

qas.question: What aspects of life is the French language important to?

plausible_answers.text: artificial political divisions within a hitherto isolated and porous region

qas.question: What role did Tuareg and Berber leaders play in the Third and Fourth republics?

context: <a0_0><a2_0>Arabic<a2_0/><a0_0/> dialects are the most widely spoken languages in the Sahara. The live in the Red Sea Hills of southeastern Egypt and eastern Sudan. Arabic, Berber and its variants now regrouped under the term Amazigh (which includes the Guanche language spoken by the original <b3_0>Berber inhabitants of the Canary Islands<b3_0/>) and Beja languages are part of <b4_0>the Afro-Asiatic or Hamito-Semitic<b4_0/> family.[citation needed] Unlike neighboring West Africa and the central governments of the states that comprise the Sahara, the French language bears little relevance to <b6_0>inter-personal discourse and commerce within the region<b6_0/>, its people retaining staunch ethnic and political affiliations with Tuareg and Berber leaders and culture. The legacy of the <a1_0>French<a1_0/> colonial era administration is primarily manifested in the territorial reorganization enacted by the Third and Fourth republics, which engendered <b7_0>artificial political divisions within a hitherto isolated and porous region<b7_0/>. Diplomacy with local clients was primarily conducted in Arabic, which was the traditional language of bureaucratic affairs. Mediation of disputes and inter-agency communication was served by interpreters contracted by <b5_0>the French government<b5_0/>, who, according to Keenan, "documented a space of intercultural mediation," contributing much to preserving indigenous cultural identities in the region.
